poemName: A conclusive thesis on modern day consumerism
poemContent: A westener went, up a mountain. Up the mountain, in search of a truth. A truth turned to a revelation, of answers he would not accept, his only detriment, and this ingrained prejudice grew and bred, like that desire for the latest iPhone, must always be so new, and his greed for money, a rat in the cycle, what an idiot. who would've knew? 
